citation.article-title: Deoxyribonucleic acid relatedness between serogroups and serovars in the family Leptospiroceae with proposals for seven new Leptospira species.

p.s: Description of Leptospira borgpetersenii sp . nov.

Leptospira borgpetersenii (borg. pe' ter. sen. i. i. N.L. gen. n. borgpetersenii to honor C. Borg-Petersen, the Danish physician who made significant early contributions to the epidemiology and microbiology of leptospirosis in Europe)
Leptospira borgpetersenii does not grow at 11 or 37°C.
Its growth is inhibited by 8-azaguanine (225 μg/ml) and copper sulfate (100 ppm), but growth is usually not inhibited by 2,6-diaminopurine (10 μg/ml).
It contains serovars from serogroups Javanica, Ballum, Hebdomadis (subserogroup Mini), Sejroe (subserogroup Sejroe), and Tarassovi (subserogroup Tarassovi).
The type strain, strain Veldrat Bataviae 46 (= ATCC 43292), is a member of serogroup Javanica and serovar javanica, was isolated from a Java house rat (Rattus brevicaudatus) in Indonesia by M.
Sardjito et al., and was first serotyped by H.
Esseveld (6, 20); it has a G+C of 39.8 k 0.3 mol%.
